On this page

Key Stakeholders ​

Communication Overview ​

Use this map to quickly identify who to contact for different issues:

Internal Stakeholders ​

Publishing Services Leadership ​

RoleResponsibilitiesKey Interactions
Director, Publishing ServicesStrategic direction, budget, vendor managementExecutive reporting, major escalations
Manager, HS PermissionsHS team operations, KPIs, trainingEditorial liaison, process improvement
Manager, S&T PermissionsS&T team operations, publisher relationsJournal management, complex negotiations

Operations Team ​

RoleResponsibilitiesKey Interactions
Team LeadsDaily workflow, quality control, mentoringEscalation handling, reporting
Senior SpecialistsComplex cases, training, process documentationKnowledge transfer, quality reviews
Permissions SpecialistsPermission requests, follow-ups, documentationRights holders, RPC management

Supporting Departments ​

DepartmentRole in PermissionsContact For
EditorialDefine content needs, approve substitutionsContent questions, timeline changes
ProductionReceive cleared assets, format requirementsFile delivery, technical specs
LegalComplex rights interpretation, disputesUnusual terms, litigation risk
FinancePayment processing, budget trackingInvoice issues, cost approvals
Technology/ITSystem support, integrationsRPC issues, system access

External Stakeholders ​

Rights Holders ​

Individual Authors ​

CharacteristicEngagement Approach
Academic researchersProfessional, cite their work appropriately
Medical professionalsRespect clinical expertise, clear purpose
Freelance creatorsClear licensing terms, prompt payment
Retired authorsMay need help with process, patience

Publishers ​

Publisher TypeTypical Process
Major scientific publishersFormal portals, standardized fees
University pressesAcademic courtesy, reasonable fees
Medical societiesMember benefits may apply
Commercial publishersStrict terms, higher fees

Organizations ​

Organization TypeConsiderations
Government agenciesOften public domain, verify
Research institutionsIP policies vary, verify ownership
Hospitals/clinicsPatient privacy concerns, HIPAA
FoundationsMay have mission-aligned discounts

Third-Party Services ​

Copyright Clearance Center (CCC) ​

ServiceUse Case
RightsLinkOnline license purchases
Republication Licensing ServiceBulk license management
Annual Copyright LicenseBlanket permissions

Other Services ​

ServiceFunction
ORCIDAuthor identification
CrossrefDOI lookup, citation data
PubMedMedical literature search
Google ScholarAuthor contact discovery

Stakeholder Communication Matrix ​

Who to Contact for What ​

IssueFirst ContactEscalation
Cannot identify rights holderTeam LeadSenior Specialist
Rights holder unresponsiveFollow escalation cadenceTeam Lead
Excessive fee quotedTeam LeadManager
Complex licensing termsSenior SpecialistLegal
System issues (RPC)IT Help DeskTechnology Team
Timeline concernsEditorial contactManager
Payment issuesFinance teamManager

Escalation Path ​

Building Stakeholder Relationships ​

Best Practices ​

  1. Be Professional - Clear, concise communication
  2. Be Persistent - Appropriate follow-up schedule
  3. Be Respectful - Acknowledge their time and work
  4. Be Accurate - Double-check all details
  5. Be Documented - Log all interactions in RPC

Common Pain Points ​

StakeholderCommon ConcernHow to Address
Authors"Why do you need this?"Clear explanation of use
Publishers"Slow response"Meet committed timelines
Editorial"Timeline at risk"Early communication
Finance"Unexpected costs"Better forecasting
